description: AP-02 is the legacy RTO code for Ananthapuramu district in Andhra Pradesh. Since February 2019, Andhra Pradesh implemented the 'one state-one code' policy where all new vehicles are registered with AP-39/AP-40 series. This office continues to manage legacy AP-02 registrations and provide regional transport services.
address: Regional Transport Office, Bhairava Nagar, Near JNTU Engineering College, Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-03 is the legacy RTO code for Chittoor district in Andhra Pradesh. Since February 2019, the state implemented the 'one state-one code' policy where all new vehicles are registered with AP-39/AP-40 series. This office continues to manage legacy AP-03 registrations.
address: No. 1 & 2, Industrial Estate, Puttur Road, Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-04 is the legacy RTO code for YSR Kadapa district in Andhra Pradesh. Since February 2019, the state implemented the 'one state-one code' policy where all new vehicles are registered with AP-39/AP-40 series. This office continues to manage legacy AP-04 registrations.

address: Regional Transport Office, Eluru, West Godavari District, Andhra Pradesh

description: AP-39 is the primary unified vehicle registration code for the entire state of Andhra Pradesh. Since February 2019, Andhra Pradesh became the first state in India to implement the 'one state-one code' policy. All new vehicles across all districts are now registered with the AP-39 series, streamlining the registration process and enabling uniform identification across the state.

AP-40 is an additional unified vehicle registration code for Andhra Pradesh, launched in 2023 to supplement the AP-39 series. As the AP-39 series approached capacity limits, the state government introduced AP-40 to continue the 'one state-one code' policy. Both AP-39 and AP-40 are valid for new vehicle registrations across all districts.
